body:
> This was discussed on the list beforehand, but indeed, this proposal
> declares that one repo == one project. Certain existing repos (notably
> golang.org/x) are noncompliant, and would need to be split out to
> conform. This and other ramifications were considered to be acceptable
> costs for the benefit of the simplifying abstraction.

If that's so (and I don't see it clearly resolved on this issue's comment history), then I suggest the changes to the code be done and shown to be successful before this proposal is accepted. Then the argument that the definition of project is reasonable will include a list of current projects and successfully converted projects. Ideally with a tool to check them and a site (maybe godoc.org) to track them.

None of these steps require a proposal be accepted, and I believe would be valuable in helping prove out any proposal.
